rComments: Hard class but he makes it better. Wish he would do some examples of computation in class tho as we are tested on it
Problem sets are hard but bring you a insight of the topics. The only thing I am not satisfied with is that lectures are all about proofs but he tests on computation stuffs.

The problem sets are beautiful and enlightening. His lectures are sometimes difficult to understand, but after getting used to the concepts they will become second nature to you. The tests usually have 4 problems, 3 of which are very easy and 1 problem which will be quite difficult. This course has made me interested in geometry, 10/10.

Problem sets are extremely hard, tests are fair, be ready to understand the theoretical part of the concepts in lecture, and learn the computations on your own. Explain concepts very well, will take his course again if any :)
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Participation matters', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: He's fine. Class average was really low for all term tests but he curved a lot in the end.

Amazing professor. Turns one of the most challenging courses at U of T into an enjoyable and very rewarding experience if you're willing to work hard. Explains difficult concepts in an intuitive and accessible manner, particularly manifolds and differential forms. Problem sets/ exams are difficult, but would definitely take Bierstone again.
His course is a gift if you're willing to work hard. He's one of my favourite profs at UofT.

I did well on all the homework, but had a bad exam (bad day). He was unsympathetic. This was years ago, circa 1997. I approached him about this, but offered no help, only a few insults ("not deserving," etc.). Subsequently, when I became a professor in the US, I always remembered cold-hearted Bierstone, and reminded myself never to be like him.
Simply the best of my first year. Made the supposedly hardest first year math course so much easier to deal with.
teacherRatingTags: ['Respected', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Fantastic prof. Cares about students and encourages participation. Very knowledgeable. Hope he continues to teach undergrad.
He goes nice and slowly so everyone can keep up. It does get sort of dull sometimes though. I heard he's better for higher level classes though.
Best prof, so nice and patient
The best, most hardcore prof. I had in my freshman year.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Terrible. Even worse than the first time I had him. Definitely the most boring and stuck up teacher I've ever had. Such a shame since this subject is interesting. At least he didn't teach the follow up class for this though.
worst professor at uoft

Worst professor I've ever had. Embarrassment to legitimate teachers everywhere. Not looking forward to having him for any more classes. Word of advice: Don't go to class if you actually want to learn or be interested in the subject
Great professor.  Tough course but very interesting and satisfying if willing to put the tine and effort.
I love this course, he actually made me thinking switch from math major to math specialists. Very inspiring prof

He speaks too low and so you if you are not sitting in the first or second row you are going to miss most of his lecture. The problem sets are impossible and take you hours to do them. Same for exams, the average was horrible. Actually would have preferred a younger and more energetic professor for that course

This course was brutal, despite I received an A from it, still have nightmares about those problem sets and tests. He had made this course unacceptably too hard to undergrad students. The choice of textbook wasn't great either.

Complex Analysis is a hard course, so don't take it if you can't stomach abstract math. If you can, he is the best professor to learn from. His courses are absolutely difficult in the best way. He has a gift for elegant explanations and presentation. He is organized and demands effort from his students. One of the best teachers I've had.
impeccable style
Amazing prof.  This course made me major in math.  His problem sets were (at least one of) the highlights of my undergrad, esp. the bonus problems.  Lucid lectures.
Amazing prof. - one of the best I've had in university. His lectures are very entertaining. The assignments and tests in this class were very difficult.
Great prof, hard class!
This guy is the kind of teacher you're lucky to get once in a lifetime.
The best there is
